comment:
* FieldDelegate is notified by the various {@code Format} * implementations as they are formatting the Objects. This allows for * storage of the individual sections of the formatted String for * later use, such as in a {@code FieldPosition} or for an * {@code AttributedCharacterIterator}. *

* Delegates should NOT assume that the {@code Format} will notify * the delegate of fields in any particular order. * * @see FieldPosition#getFieldDelegate * @see CharacterIteratorFieldDelegate

methods.name: public void formatted(Format.Field attr, Object value, int start, int end, StringBuffer buffer)
methods.comment:
* Notified when a particular region of the String is formatted. This
         * method will be invoked if there is no corresponding integer field id
         * matching {@code attr}.
         *
         * @param attr Identifies the field matched
         * @param value Value associated with the field
         * @param start Beginning location of the field, will be >= 0
         * @param end End of the field, will be >= start and <= buffer.length()
         * @param buffer Contains current formatted value, receiver should
         *        NOT modify it.

methods.name: public void formatted(int fieldID, Format.Field attr, Object value, int start, int end, StringBuffer buffer)
methods.comment:
* Notified when a particular region of the String is formatted.
         *
         * @param fieldID Identifies the field by integer
         * @param attr Identifies the field matched
         * @param value Value associated with the field
         * @param start Beginning location of the field, will be >= 0
         * @param end End of the field, will be >= start and <= buffer.length()
         * @param buffer Contains current formatted value, receiver should
         *        NOT modify it.

methodNames: public void formatted(Format.Field attr, Object value, int start, int end, StringBuffer buffer)
public void formatted(int fieldID, Format.Field attr, Object value, int start, int end, StringBuffer buffer)
